snippet.title: Electronika 60 Game: Tetris (1984)
snippet.description:
An original Tetris game that was programmed on the Electronika 60 by Alexey Pajitnov at the the Soviet Academy of Sciences at Computer Center in Moscow Russia. As a puzzle game, the player must drop the randomly generated shapes to the bottom of the screen to form a horizontal line. They can be rotated and translated on a horizontal axis. The blocks automatically fall down and falls faster as the game progresses. When blocks stack on top of each other and no longer fits on top of the screen, the game is over. When blocks form a horizontal line, that line is removed and disappears and creating more space for blocks to fall to the bottom of the playfield to continous play. 

Note: Good game for the original. More of a simulation of the original Tetris game than an emulation as it only represents the behavior how a game is played being setup on another computer system which is only a adaptation and very close to original you can get. For more information on how to get setup and how to play, you can find it here at this link here

https://tetris.wiki/Tetris_(Electronica_60)

After clicking on the link above, be sure to add the ) at the end of the link on the address bar, for some reason, it's only getting part of the link.
